reasoning: Seasonal influenza incidence estimated at approximately 3-11% of population per year, or 3,000-11,000 per 100,000. Using global estimate of ~8% incidence (8,000 per 100,000) as middle estimate. High geographic and temporal variation. NEC (Not Elsewhere Classified) category encompasses uncomplicated influenza cases.
source: CDC Influenza Division; WHO Influenza Programme
